text: this is the main government hospital in
the middle of Tacloban and this hospital
it's just near the seafront it was
completely flooded during the storm
surge you can still see some of the mud
on the ground here but they are getting
it back up and running again this is
where the casualties come in when
they're first admitted and you can see
over here this young girl was brought in
about half an hour ago and she has a
very very serious cut on her head and
it's you can see that it's suffocating
it's it's a typical of the sort of
laceration that's been left for a few
days and it's starting to get septic
over here behind us is where they bring
the babies in and see this little girl
here on this bed she has a fever she has
diarrhea again typical of the symptoms
of what happens when babies are drinking
dirty water when they're in an
unsanitary place she's got a high fever
she's on a drip but they literally don't
have enough water to give her water to
drink there is medicine here but it's
very very basic and the doctors we've
been talking to say they need everything
